basics.name: Jarrod Lofy
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2018.

highlights: Formulated scouting materials and statistics of opposing team weekly.
Managed clerical office work and record keeping.
Took part in leading the team to the NCAA tournament for the first time in over 10 years.
Designed "Swipe Breaker" from the ground up.
Developed solutions pertianing to unique user input.
Published the game to both iOS and Android platforms.

work.summary: Worked in support of construction team for up to 8 projects at a single time
highlights: Oversaw procurement of materials, buyout, budgeting, scheduling, coordinated billing, and drafted subcontracts.

volunteer.summary: Developed a new teaching application "Step-By-Step Mathematics" for mobile devices
highlights: Designed teaching application based on new design process intended to help students understand the process of problem solving
Managed development team to deliver application on time and at budget.
Recieved first place award at poster presentation for engineering and computer sciences.

volunteer.organization: Office of Enterprise Technology Services Transformation Internship Program
highlights: Developed training materials for project management process training.
Presented developed materials to Gov. Ige at the end of the program.

awards.title: Disrupt Army Hackathon
awards.summary: Competed to create best calander design to allow Army Generals to make decisions on where they were spending time.

awards.title: Hawaii Annual Code Challenge
awards.summary: Develoepd web application to highlight voting choices in the State of Hawai'i.

awards.title: UROP Showcase
awards.summary: Engineering & Computer Sciences Poster Presentation for Step-By-Step Mathematics teaching application

awards.title: UH Manoa Dean's List
awards.summary: Earned a total 3.5 GPA for a semster

awards.title: Gov. Ige Athletics Honor
awards.summary: Award in recognition for excellent atheltic performance at UH Manoa

awards.title: Mountain Pacific Sports Federation
awards.summary: In recognition of excellent classroom performance by a student-athlete

awards.title: Eagle Scout
awards.summary: Highest rank within the Boy Scouts of America, built a sand volleyball court as the final requirment
